content: In Greek mythology, who was the god of blacksmiths, craftsmen, artisans, sculptors, metals, metallurgy, fire and volcanoes?

In Greek mythology, the god of blacksmiths, craftsmen, artisans, sculptors, metals, metallurgy, fire, and volcanoes was Hephaestus. He was known for his skill in working with metals and was often depicted as a hardworking craftsman, creating many of the weapons and tools used by the other gods and goddesses. His Roman counterpart was Vulcan.
